Newsletter

Best of Show 2019 in a regional jury competition in San Diego under the category of Publication Layout and Design


The concept of the magazine “World of Dance” shown in this project is to introduce the audience with original dances from different countries. The issue that I’m presenting here is dedicated to showing original dances from Argentina. This project became very personal to me because Argentinian dances have played a major role in my life as my main hobby. I have been dancing Argentinian folklore dances and tango for about 10 years now. All the photos used in this artwork are part of a collection of photos from my past performances.



The software I used for this project is Photoshop, InDesign, and Illustrator. My goal in this project was to create a design that portraits the spirit of Argentinian dances. That’s why I choose different color solutions in different pages. The first page of this project is about folklore dances Chacarera, Malambo, Escondido, and Gato. They are original from rural areas of Argentina. Because of this reason I’ve chosen a photo of the countryside where my cousin and I are dancing in front of the wooden house of my grandparents.

All the types of dances I describe on a first page have a similar vibe because they all have fast, energetic, joyful, and allegro music tempo. The color palette of the first page corresponds to that. I used a combination of Burgundy and Scarlet shades of Red color altogether with Grass green color. The second and third pages are paired pages and have the same color scheme. Blue is the color of the official flag of Argentina. The dance theme for these pages is Tango, which is the most popular dance coming from Argentina. Tango in its very nature is more sophisticated and comes from the urban area of Buenos Aires which corresponds to a more minimalistic and elegant design. The color scheme of the 1st and 4th pages is different from the 2nd and 3rd pages although the Scarlet red color of the tango dancer dress makes a peaceful transition between them and links them all together.

The target audience of this newsletter could be travelers but also people who like to learn more about different countries and their original and folkloric dances. Reference to traveling elements of design is presented in icons showing airplanes, world maps, and earth’s globe.
